DataElement.preferredDefinition: the diameter of a cylinder-shaped brachytherapy implant.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the diameter (the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference) of an implanted brachytherapy cylinder (a surface formed by circles of a given radius that are contained in a plane perpendicular to a given axis, whose centers align on the axis).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A surface formed by circles of a given radius that are contained in a plane perpendicular to a given axis, whose centers align on the axis.:(ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: A surface formed by circles of a given radius that are contained in a plane perpendicular to a given axis, whose centers align on the axis.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

Property.preferredDefinition: A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a measurement of a brachytherapy implant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
